com.github.breadmoirai.breadbot.framework.builder

Interface CommandParameterBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommandParameterBuilderImpl

    public interface CommandParameterBuilder
    This is used to set settings for command parameters.

      • setName

        CommandParameterBuilder setName(java.lang.String paramName)
        Sets the name of this parameter. Primarily used for debugging. If -parameters is not passed to javac, parameter names will not be included in the compiled code and thus appear as arg0, arg1, arg2, ..., otherwise it will appear as in your code.
        Parameters:
        paramName - the name of the parameter.
        Returns:
        this obj.

      • setIndex

        CommandParameterBuilder setIndex(int index)
        If index > 0, the parser will only attempt to map the argument at the specified position. If the position is out of bounds, this parameter will be passed null. The first argument consumed will always be at this index. If the width is positive and there are not enough arguments to satisfy that width starting from this index, null will be passed. By default the index is set to 0 which means that there is no specific index. If the index is set to a negative value, it will count backwards where the last argument is at index -1.
        Parameters:
        index - the starting index of the argument to consume.
        Returns:
        this builder instance

      • setWidth

        CommandParameterBuilder setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the argument, how many tokens the parse should consume. By default this is set to 1, meaning it will only ever consume 1 argument or 0 if it cannot match anything. If the width is set to 0, it will try every contiguous combination of arguments starting from the largest size. If the width is set to a negative value, it will attempt each group of contiguous arguments. If the width is set to a positive value greater that 1, it will try every group of contiguous arguments of that exact size.
        Parameters:
        width - the number of arguments to consume.
        Returns:
        this builder instance

        CommandParameterBuilder setRequired(boolean mustBePresent)
        Parameters:
        mustBePresent - true if the argument must be present. Otherwise an error message will be sent to the user with the default error or
        Returns:
        this

      • setOnAbsentArgument

        CommandParameterBuilder setOnAbsentArgument(AbsentArgumentHandler onAbsentArgument)
        Defines the behavior to be executed when the parameter could not be mapped from any unmapped CommandEventArguments.
        Parameters:
        onAbsentArgument - A MissingArgumentHandler which is a functional interface that is a BiConsumer of the CommandEvent and the CommandParameter that is missing
        Returns:
        this

      • setContiguous

        CommandParameterBuilder setContiguous(boolean isContiguous)
        This only affects parameters which are Collections. If contiguous is set to true, that means that only adjacent arguments will be provided in the parameter where the first element is the first unmapped argument that is of the Collection's Generic Type. If contiguous is set to false, then all unmapped arguments which can be mapped to this Collection's Generic Type will be present in this parameter.

        By default, this field is set to false.

        Parameters:
        isContiguous - a boolean.
        Returns:
        this

      • setLimit

        CommandParameterBuilder setLimit(int limit)
        This only affects parameters that contain multiple arguments such as a Stream or a List. This field determines the maximum amount of arguments to include. By default this is set to -1.
        Parameters:
        limit - An int determining the maximum amount of arguments to contain.
        Returns:
        this
